abstract: Conference Board announces consumer confidence rose in January, from December 2015; Standard & Poor's/Case-Shiller 20-city home price index rose in November 2015 by 5.8 percent, compared with year ago, and National Assn of Realtors says sales of existing homes rose 6.5 percent over past year, to 5.26 million.

headline.print_headline: Home Prices Gain, Aided by Strong Hiring Growth
headline.main: Home Prices Rise, Aided by Strong Hiring Growth

keywords.value: Standard & Poor's Case-Shiller Home Price Index
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The Standard & Poor’s/Case-Shiller 20-city home price index rose 5.8 percent from a year ago, up from a 5.5 percent pace in October, according to a report on Tuesday.
lead_paragraph: The Standard & Poor’s/Case-Shiller 20-city home price index rose 5.8 percent from a year ago, up from a 5.5 percent pace in October, according to a report on Tuesday.
